pageContext.title: I oversee government digital services at GovTech. Ask me anything!
pageContext.content:
NOTE: This AMA has ended. Find the Q&A with Parimal in theÂ comments.

Hi TIA Community!

Iâ€™m Parimal Aswani, director of government digital services at GovTech. I leadÂ the design and development of digital services and platforms for the Singapore government.

Prior to joining GovTech, I was involved in providing technology leadership and managing software development teams, including a stint as director of technology at DreamWorks Animation. I started my career at startups in an engineering leadership capacity, building products across different domains like digital cinema, medical imaging, and gaming.

I am a proponent of open source, agile development, and devops practices. Iâ€™ll also be speaking at GovTechâ€™s first ever developer conference â€“ catch me if youâ€™ve got the time!

Feel free to ask me anything! Here are some examples of questions Iâ€™d love to answer:

  • What is it like to be a software/devops engineer or designer at GovTech?
  • Why are we using agile and devops to deliver user-centric design and services? What does devops mean for an organization like GovTech?
  • What problems are we trying to solve? What are some of the exciting projects we are working on?
  • How are we using open source in the government and why should your organization do that too?
  • What kind of skills or culture is required for a team to be successful in your area of work?

Note fromÂ Putra, TIAâ€™s head of community content:Â The host may choose at his preference to not answer particular questions. The AMA is moderated by the community managers, so letâ€™s keep the questions friendly.Â ðŸ™‚
